title: Ebey's Landing National Historical Reserve: Our Staff & Offices
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Our Staff & Offices              Our Staff & Offices         The Ebey's Prairie Bluff Trail Photo by TB of Ebey's Landing NHR  Trust Board of Ebey's Landing National Historical Reserve The Reserve is the first National Historical Reserve designated in the National Park System. Policy oversight is carried out by a nine-member Trust Board composed of local volunteers and representatives from the Town of Coupeville, Island County, Washington State Parks, and the National Park Service. The Trust Board serves as the Superintendent of this unit, carrying out specific tasks, with assistance by assigned staff from the National Park Service.  Â   Office of the Trust Board of Ebey's Landing NHR:The Cottage at Sunnyside162 Cemetery Rd.Coupeville, WA 98239 Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:30am to 4:30pmMailing Address:  PO Box 774, Coupeville, WA 98239Phone: 360.678.6084 Trust Board Staff:  Kristen Griffin, Reserve Manager, e-mail usCarol Castellano, Office Manager, e-mail usSarah Steen, Preservation Coordinator, e-mail usHolly Richards, Outreach Coordinator, e-mail us Office of Ebey's Landing NHR (NPS Office):Reuble Farm, Fort Casey Rd.Coupeville, WA 98239.Office Hours:  Monday-Friday, 8:30am to 4:30pmMailing Address:  PO Box 774, Coupeville, WA 98239Phone: 360.678.5787 Ebey's Landing NHR Staff:  Roy Zipp, Operations Manager, e-mail usScott Swenson, Preservationist,  e-mail us
